trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> objects that are selected in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
The order of columns in the collection is not guaranteed to match the order in which they were selected.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection> does not perform efficiently when working with large numbers of columns.

Typically, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> controls will not contain enough columns for this to be an issue, but if you are working with large numbers of columns, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.AreAllCellsSelected%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to determine if the entire grid is selected, or you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection.GetColumnCount%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to determine the number of selected columns (or the number of columns in a specified state).
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Clears the collection.
This method is not relevant for this class.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection> class directly.
To clear the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ClearSelection%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Always thrown.
Determines whether the specified column is contained in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the dataGridViewColumn parameter is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.
The cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.
Inserts a column into the collection at the specified position.
This method is not relevant for this class.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection> class directly.
To insert a column into the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewBand.Selected%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The zero-based index at which the column should be inserted.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Gets the column at the specified index.
The index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> to get from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> at the specified index.
index is less than 0.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the number of columns in the collection.
Gets the list of elements contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection"></xref> instance.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> containing the elements of the collection.
This property returns `null` unless overridden in a derived class.
Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.
The cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.
Gets the number of elements in the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The number of elements in the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection"></xref>.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref> method.
Always throws <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref>.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection> class directly.

The item to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection"></xref>.
Not applicable.

Always thrown.
